title: Chemical and Physical Changes in Matter

vocab.definition: A change in matter that doesn't create a new substance
A change that creates one or more new substances
A process where substances interact to form new substances
A substance that enters into a chemical reaction
A substance formed as a result of a chemical reaction

teachingNotes: Use demonstrations like melting ice (physical) vs burning paper (chemical). Emphasize that chemical changes are usually irreversible.

sample.question: What type of change creates one or more new substances?

truefalse.question: Melting ice is an example of a chemical change.

multiplechoice.question: Which is an example of a physical change?

fillintheblank.question: A substance that enters into a chemical reaction is called a ________.

shortanswer.question: How can you tell if a chemical change has occurred?
expectedAny: color change, gas produced, temperature change
